channel.title: price-ratios on Reed Douglas
channel.description: Recent content in price-ratios on Reed Douglas

item.title: Where do Price-Ratios Vary?
item.description: Table of Contents Where do Price-Ratios Vary? Where do Price-Ratios Vary? In my most recent working paper, The Cross-Sectional Variation of Stock Prices, I examine individual stock price-ratios instead of returns. Price-ratios are meaningfully different from returns, and tend to vary significantly more in the cross-section than they do in the time series. I decompose the variation in price ratios (specifically, Price-to-Net Payouts (P/D) and Price-to-Earnings (P/E)), and I find that between 94% and 96% of the total variation in price-ratios lies in the Fama-MacBeth style cross-section.
